title: Adjust itinerary date range format, wrap schedule row overflow, and shorten connector arrows (selected elements only)

requirements.text: Update the journey period text rendered in the selected header paragraph element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[5]/div[1]/div[7]/div[1]/p[1]) to use the format "18 Feb 26 (Wed) ~ 20 Feb 26 (Fri)" (day number, short month name, 2-digit year, weekday abbreviation in parentheses; separator must be " ~ ").

quotes: Revise the journey period format to like "18 Feb 26 (Wed) ~ 20 Feb 26 (Fri)"

acceptanceCriteria: The journey period displays as "DD Mon YY (Ddd) ~ DD Mon YY (Ddd)" (example: "18 Feb 26 (Wed) ~ 20 Feb 26 (Fri)").
Weekday is abbreviated (e.g., Mon/Tue/Wed), month is abbreviated (Jan/Feb/Mar...), and year is 2 digits.
The separator between start and end is a tilde with spaces: " ~ " (not a hyphen).

requirements.text: In the selected schedule row container element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[5]/div[1]/div[7]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]), change the schedule items layout so that when the window is too narrow to show the full row content, the overflow content wraps onto the next line(s) (no horizontal scrolling required to see all schedule items).

quotes: if the current window cannot show the full schedule content of that row, move the content to the next row

acceptanceCriteria: When reducing viewport width, schedule items that do not fit on the first line wrap onto subsequent line(s) within the same day row container.
All schedule items remain visible without horizontal scrolling.
The day label remains on the left and schedule content remains to the right (same row structure as before, only wrapping behavior changes).

requirements.text: Reduce the connector arrow length by approximately 50% for the selected arrow SVG element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[5]/div[1]/div[7]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]/svg[1]) while preserving its existing dotted curved style and arrowhead.
acceptanceCriteria: The visual width of the connector arrow is ~50% shorter than before.
The arrow remains a dotted curved line with an arrowhead and matches the existing styling (stroke, dash pattern, linecap).
No other non-selected icons/arrows outside the selected SVG element are modified.

constraints: Apply changes ONLY to the three selected elements identified by the provided XPaths; do not modify other UI outside those selected elements.
Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other frontend immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not change backend data models or persistence.
Do not redesign the overall theme; only implement the specified layout/formatting changes.
